moves.1. e4 e5 2. Qh5: Patzer opening.  It is generally advised to avoid getting the queen out early in the game, unless one is playing against lower rated beginners.
moves.2... d6 3. Bb5+ c6 4. Bc4: Black must defend against QxPf7#.  This is not difficult to manage, though.
moves.4... Nh6: Pg6 also works, and forces the queen to move.
moves.5. d3: White eyes BxNh6.  If black plays PxBh6, white wins.  Black should be able to defend the knight with Pg6.
moves.5... b5 6. Bb3 a5: Qc7 might have been better.  White essentially gets a free knight here.
moves.7. Bxh6 g6: ...or maybe not.  Pushing the queen--the bishop trade can wait.  Black has h4 and h3 covered.
moves.8. Qf3: Black should play Be6 here, or Pf6 might be even better.
